name: Avoid using oninput in body containing input autofocus
description:
This is a passive JavaScript execution via <BODY> and oninput attribute. 
All browsers besides Internet Explorer 9 support the "oninput" event handler around form elements like the given <INPUT>. The event works for the form elements itself, the surrounding form and <BODY> as well as <HTML> tags. This rule is compliant with CISQ OMG ASCSM-CWE-079 recommendation and OWASP 2013 A3 recommendation.
output:
Line and column for each violation 
Associated value => number of violations found
rationale: Ensure you don't use html pattern that can give a way to execute code without user interaction.
